title: 115_s1210
content: SECTION 1. REDUCTION IN TAX RATES. Individual Tax Rates are being reduced under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017. This includes reductions in the 15%, 25%, 28%, and 33% rate brackets. Individual Tax Rates are being reduced under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017. This includes adjustments in the highest rate brackets by substituting percentages in specific clauses. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce individual tax rates, including adjustments to highest rate brackets by substituting percentages in specific clauses. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce individual tax rates, including adjustments to highest rate brackets by substituting percentages in specific clauses. The changes include lowering the rates from 15% to 13%, 20% to 18%, 25% to 23%, and 28% to 26%. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce individual tax rates, including adjustments to highest rate brackets by substituting percentages in specific clauses. Conforming amendments are made to various sections, lowering rates from 20% to 18%. Corporate tax rates are also addressed. The United States Code is amended to lower corporate tax rates, with reductions from 35% to 33% in specific clauses. Conforming amendments are also made to adjust rates accordingly. The United States Code is amended to lower corporate tax rates from 35% to 33% in specific clauses, with conforming amendments made to adjust rates accordingly. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017, with certain withholding-related amendments taking effect on January 1, 2018.
